p: While LPGs are predominantly sensitive to strain temperature, curvature and surrounding RI [ 52], the combination of tapers with LPGs can offer an increase in sensitivity and functionality via enhancement of the interaction of the EW with the surrounding medium. Periodic tapering of an optical fibre using CO 2 laser as a heating source can be used as an alternative to UV laser based inscription methods for LPG fabrication, as shown in Figure 7 [ 53, 54] with ultra-short (<400 micron length) tapered LPGs recently demonstrated using CO 2 laser fabrication [ 55].
